abstract: German Chancellor Angela Merkel uses occasion of accepting her party's nomination for another term to urge ban on full-face veils and to suggest Germany may become more cautious in accepting migrants; comments reflect effort to maintain power in face of challenge from growing far-right populist element.
lead_paragraph: Accepting her party’s nomination as their candidate for another four-year term, the chancellor also made a promise that Shariah law would never replace German justice.
